title: Test2BPoints and Test2BBKDPoints.test2D() failure: wrong number of points in split
description:
My Jenkins found failures in Test2BBKDPoints and Test2BPoints in the same run on branch_6x; I've reported here before seeing them reproduce because the tests took 12 and 20 hours to run, respectively.


Checking out Revision 39aaa108ac8a85809080e4f7cf2b5ac0cc0d0fe9 (refs/remotes/origin/branch_6x)

FWIW, here's how the suite was run (via Jenkins):


ant -f lucene/core/build.xml clean test -Dtests.jvms=4 -Dtests.nightly=true -Dtests.monster=true -Dtests.heapsize=30g

comments.author: Michael McCandless
comments.content: Also, have you run the monster tests on 6.0 branch?  I haven't been backporting the recent BKD optimizations there ... I'm curious if it was a recent 6.x only opto that caused this.

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content:
Test2BBKDPoints.test2D() reproduced, but Test2BPoints.test2D() hit OOM - I didn't add -Dtests.heapsize to either invocation.  Retrying Test2BPoints.test2D() now with -Dtests.heapsize=30g.

No, I haven't run the monster tests on 6.0, but it's a good idea, I'll tell my Jenkins to do that.

comments.author: ASF subversion and git services
comments.content:
Commit 28a4335813df24e3db8269efe60347c2275e0b03 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/branch_6x from Mike McCandless
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=28a4335 ]

LUCENE-7142: BKDWriter wasn't splitting correctly with long ords; improve tests so we sometimes long ords even for small number of points

comments.author: ASF subversion and git services
comments.content:
Commit 7b93fc46b1e284494a500f4df541269bdfa67dcf in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Mike McCandless
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=7b93fc4 ]

LUCENE-7142: BKDWriter wasn't splitting correctly with long ords; improve tests so we sometimes long ords even for small number of points

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content: So I guess 6.0 isn't affected, Michael McCandless (since you didn't merge to branch_6_0)?  Fix version should be set to 6.1 then?

comments.author: Michael McCandless
comments.content: Yes, Steve Rowe!  I set it.  But it's still separately good to know whether 2B tests are passing on 6.0 ... I fear we have no Jenkins coverage of 6.0 now

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.content: I'm running the 6.0 monster tests now: http://jenkins.sarowe.net/job/Lucene-core-weekly-monster-6.0-HDD/1/console

comments.author: Hoss Man
comments.content: Manually correcting fixVersion per Step #S5 of LUCENE-7271
